Contact - The Villages Polo Club : The Villages Polo Club Schedule Program Admission Day-of General Admission Season Passes Learn The Sport Lessons About Our Club The Final Chukker FAQ Events Contact Become a Sponsor Menu Schedule Program Admission Day-of General Admission Season Passes Learn The Sport Lessons About Our Club The Final Chukker FAQ Events Contact Become a Sponsor CONTACT US The Villages Polo Club 700 N Buena Vista Blvd The Villages, FL 32162 Phone: (352) 750-7656 (POLO) Fax: (352) 259-4473 Mailing Address ATTN: The Villages Polo Club 7580 Middleton Dr Middleton, FL 34762 Email: polo.events@thevillages.com New Season Passes will be available for purchase starting September 5th at the Polo office. Hours:
                Mon-Thu 10am-3pm Polo Office 703 N. Buena Vista Blvd. 352-750-7656 Enjoy your time off the field! Accommodation Options The Brownwood Hotel & Spa 3003 Brownwood Boulevard, The Villages, FL, 32163 Phone: 352-626-1246 Located in the heart of Florida’s friendliest hometown as the only premier AAA 4-diamond location, The Brownwood Hotel & Spa invites you to celebrate the past and the
            present. We embrace the history of the Floridian cowboy, offering guests a glimpse into the state’s true heritage. With 151 thoughtfully-appointed rooms, a medi-spa, and endless attractions, guests of all generations will
            follow their adventurous spirit and cherish our unparalleled hospitality. The Waterfront Inn located in Lake Sumter Landing Market Square® 1105 Lakeshore Drive, The Villages, FL, 32159 Phone: 352-753-7535 Lake Sumter Landing™ is a great place to take in as much of the shopping and dining and fun that you’ll find
            throughout our hometown – all in one place! You’ll find FREE entertainment every night on the square surrounded by local and nationally known boutiques,
            restaurants, and a movie theater all in a quaint, waterfront setting. For shorter stays, The Waterfront Inn is located at Lake Sumter Landing™ and can be
            contracted at 800-528-3132. For longer stays, monthly house rentals may also be arranged. For questions on any of your lodging needs, please call us at 352-750-7656 or email us for information. Hampton Inn & Suites 11727 NE 63rd Dr, Lady Lake, FL 32162 Phone: 352-259-8246 Website Just a few short minutes from The Villages Polo Club, Hampton Inn is available for hotel stay! We’re a couple of miles from Highway 301. Its three miles to Lake Sumter Landing’s shops, restaurants, park, and children’s playground. The historic Spanish Springs Town Square is four miles away, and you’ll find several golf courses within a few minutes too. Relax in our outdoor pool. Daily hot breakfast and WiFi are on us. Use Corporate Code 3374940 to obtain our Polo rate! Marriott Town Place 1141 Alonzo Ave The Villages, FL 32159 352-753-8686 Website Pet Friendly Comfort Suites 1202 Avenida Central The Villages, FL 32159 352-259-6578 Website Pet Friendly Holiday Inn Express 1205 Avenida Central North The Villages, FL 32159 352-750-3888 Website Pet Friendly BECOME A SPONSOR THEVILLAGES.COM Follow Us 700 N Buena Vista Blvd The Villages, FL 32162 (352) 750-7656 © Holding Company of The Villages, Inc., 2025. Learn - The Villages Polo Club : The Villages Polo Club Schedule Program Admission Day-of General Admission Season Passes Learn The Sport Lessons About Our Club The Final Chukker FAQ Events Contact Become a Sponsor Menu Schedule Program Admission Day-of General Admission Season Passes Learn The Sport Lessons About Our Club The Final Chukker FAQ Events Contact Become a Sponsor LEARN POLO Polo is a unique sport that you can’t find just anywhere. So if you’re brand new to the game and looking for an introduction to the players, ponies and rules, or if you’re looking to get a more hands on experience and learn to actually play the game, our club can help you! THE BASICS POLO 101 POLO ACADEMY The Sport If you’re new to the sport of polo and looking for a quick lesson to get you up to speed, we’ve compiled the basics to help get you started. The length of the game is divided into six “chukkers”, seven and a half minutes each. The field is 300 yards long and 160 yards wide. On the end line at each end are goal posts, twenty four feet apart. Points are scored by hitting the ball between the posts. Each time a goal is scored the teams change direction of play. It is legal to “hook” the hitter’s mallet. It is also legal to ride your horse alongside another horse and push them aside in order to gain possession of the ball. That is called a ‘ride off’ and must be done shoulder to shoulder and at relatively the same speed. In between chukkers there is a four-minute break for players to change ponies. After three chukkers there is a ten-minute “half time.” With time-outs for penalties and the like, a typical match lasts one-and-a-half hours. Players There are four players on the field for each team, wearing a jersey numbered 1 through 4. The roles of each player are: The Forward: Always out in front – should score most of the goals. The Hustler: Quick and aggressive with fast ponies. The Pivot: The quarterback and captain. The Back: Defender. There are no goalies. It’s their job to stop the goal shots. Helmets are required, and some have face masks. Most players wear padded knee guards and they all have to wear boots. MALLETS It’s a solid bamboo cane with a hard wood head. It’s about 4 1/2 feet long and you hit a baseball-sized ball made of solid plastic with the side of the mallet, not the end. All players must hold the mallet in the right hand; left-handed play is not allowed. BALL Today’s polo ball is a baseball-sized ball made of solid plastic. Historically polo balls were made out of wood. POLO PONIES Most are Thoroughbreds but there is no regulation regarding breed or size. The tail is braided to stay out of the way of the mallet. The mane is clipped off so the player can see the ball, and to prevent the reins from getting tangled up. The idea is for each player to have six ponies – one for each chukker. POLO EQUIPMENT Polo horses are required to wear a bridle, an English saddle, and their legs are wrapped for support and added protection. Polo 101 Polo 101 will now be offered every Sunday, 30 minutes before the match, and is included in your match’s admission. Polo 101 Flyer A) Lessons Private: $200 Group: $150 Package of 10: $1500* *Packages are valid up to 60 days after time of purchase. B) Clinics Contact Mike Harris for more information. mh_polo@bellsouth.net | 561-212-2128 C) Margarita League Join us for a white pants, 2 chukker match played on Field 3 – Saturdays during season with umpires and score kept on the scoreboard! $550 providing own horse(s) $750 if renting horse(s) BECOME A SPONSOR THEVILLAGES.COM Follow Us 700 N Buena Vista Blvd The Villages, FL 32162 (352) 750-7656 © Holding Company of The Villages, Inc., 2025. All Rights Reserved. The Villages is a registered trademark of Holding Company of The Villages, Inc.

This website uses cookies to improve your experience. We'll assume you're ok with this, but you can opt-out if you wish. Read more about  our privacy policy . Cookie settings ACCEPT Privacy & Cookies Policy Close Privacy Overview This website uses cookies to improve your experience while you navigate through the website. Out of these cookies, the cookies that are categorized as necessary are stored on your browser as they are as essential for the working of basic functionalities of the website. We also use third-party cookies that help us analyze and understand how you use this website. These cookies will be stored in your browser only with your consent. You also have the option to opt-out of these cookies. But opting out of some of these cookies may have an effect on your browsing experience. Necessary Necessary Always Enabled Necessary cookies are absolutely essential for the website to function properly. This category only includes cookies that ensures basic functionalities and security features of the website. These cookies do not store any personal information.
